oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Virulence pattern in Danish races of common bunt (Tilletia caries) Common Bunt
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Borgen, Anders
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Breeding, genetics and propagation
Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: By harvesting fungal spores from partly resistant varieties (as is the practise in normal organic seed production and farming), virulent races of common bunt builds up to devastating levels. The experiment shows that virulence against rare resistance genes to common bunt might be more frequent than expected, since European resistance screening so far have been done without preselecting of virulent races.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Borgen, Anders (2014) Virulence pattern in Danish races of common bunt (Tilletia caries) Common Bunt. In: Chable, Véronique (Ed.) Diversity strategies for organic and low input agricultures and their food system.
